hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime BTC Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) with 20-day realized volatility dropping below 40% (current: ~45%) while daily RSI(14) remains between 40-60, an imminent volatility expansion will occur with directional bias toward the 200-hour SMA ($86,200). A long entry on BTC when price breaks above the 20-period Bollinger Band with volume >20% above 10-day average yields positive expectancy.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede volatility expansions. Low volatility during neutral periods creates coiled spring effect. Volume confirmation reduces false breakouts. Current BTC price action shows compression near $87.5K with declining volatility.
entry_conditions: Price breaks above 20-period Bollinger Band (2 std)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% gain or test of 200-hour SMA resistance
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 3% below entry or close below Bollinger Band midline

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain >4 hours or leads to immediate reversal below entry with expanding volume against direction.
